Name: Aqua Pazza

So the staff is reportedly well-versed in accommodating food allergies and in allergen protocols. All of their menu can be made gluten-free and you can easily custom order several dairy-free dishes.

Name: Davio's Northern Italian Steakhouse
Info: Thank you to Keira for recommending this Italian steakhouse. â€œI have a very long relationship with davios, and would recommend them in general for a fab dining experience. With the birth of my dairy allergic son, Iâ€™ve had to be super careful about consumption and davios has been incredible. They have a allergy protocol, a manager will deliver your dish personally. They are deeply knowledgeable about their menu and will modify whatever they can to ensure you have a safe and delicious lunch or dinner.â€

Name: Donut Villa Diner
Info: They have a whole vegan menu of options, including pancakes, waffles, â€œchickenâ€ and waffles, Sandwiches, scrambles, mac and cheese, and more. Additional menu items can be ordered dairy free.

Name: El Pelon Taqueria
Info: They happily welcome dairy-free and gluten-free guests, with dairy-free options for their tacos, burritos, platos, and more.

Name: Emack & Bolio's
Info: This Boston-based Ice Creamery churns a handful of vegan flavors made with coconut milk. They include Cappucino Fudge Swirl, Chocolate Pudding, Mint Chocolate Freckle, Raspberry Chocolate Krispy Rice, Goa Mango, and Toasted Coconut. They also offer dairy-free sorbets.

Name: Energize Boston
Tags: Healthy ğŸ, Drink ğŸ§‰, Smoothie ğŸ§ƒ
Info: This dairy-free and mostly vegan Cafe (they use honey on some products) is located in the Brighton neighborhood. They serve a full menu of Healthy organic salads, toasts, Smoothie bowls, and Smoothies.

Name: Energize Boston
Tags: Healthy ğŸ, Drink ğŸ§‰, Smoothie ğŸ§ƒ

Name: Estragon Tapas Bar
Info: The owner is a Madrid native, lending authentic flare to their plates. In fact, some dishes are from family recipes. They boldly label vegan and gluten-free options on their menus, of which there are many. Weâ€™ve been told theyâ€™re also well versed for other special diet needs, and have several more â€œjust dairy freeâ€ items available.

Name: Far Out
Info: The original home of this New Zealand Ice Creamery is at the Red Sox stadium. But theyâ€™re also opening a brick and mortar shop. They blend your choice of real fruit into a vanilla Ice Cream base, and have a dairy-free vanilla Ice Cream base option.

Name: Fire + Ice
Info: A reader named Janet recommended two California locations for dairy-free lunch, dinner, and brunch options. But they recently opened a third location in Boston. Itâ€™s a Mongolian BBQ type place, but they offer a global array of flavors. Since you pick your own ingredients, it makes it easy to order without dairy and choose the right sauces. Janet said, â€œIf the Grill has already been used or is being used for things that shouldnâ€™t be anywhere near my food, they take mine to the back and cook it in a separate pan and deliver it to my table.â€

Name: J.P. Licks â­ï¸
Tags: Star â­ï¸, Ice Cream ğŸ¦, Dessert ğŸ°
Info: This popular local Ice Cream chain does a great job of labeling for dairy-free, gluten-free, and vegan customers. They regularly offer some creamy dairy-free flavors, usually made with coconut milk or oat milk. They also offer nuts, coconut, crushed cookies, fruits, and peanut butter sauce as dairy-free toppings, and can whip you up a creamy dairy-free frappe, among other Drinks. For milkshakes and Coffee Drinks, they have almond milk, coconut milk, and soy milk available. They have several locations around the city.
